newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Medical deal costs Australian budget A$50 mln.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Medical deal costs Australian budget A$50 mln.

text.p: The Australian government's deal with the Democrats minority party over the number of medical doctors will cost the budget up to about A$50 million over four years, a spokeswoman for Health Minister Michael Wooldridge said on Thursday.
Earlier, Wooldridge and the Democrats announced an expected deal under which the government would boost training places for doctors in return for Democrat support for the bill.
The savings in the bill were far greater than the cost of the compromise: savings of A$106 million in 1997/98, rising to A$256 million in 1999/00.
Measures whose Senate passage is doubtful are worth about a quarter of the budget's A$7.2 billion 1997/98 fiscal tightening.
At 0445 GMT (3.45 p.m.) the Senate had returned to debate on two social security bills containing doubtful measures worth A$336 to the 1997/98 budget.
